intro: Matsumuria oldhamii, commonly known as the Oldham's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. It produces a distinctive seed head that disperses seeds via the wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
